com.microsoft.azure.management.datalake.store.uploader

Class MultipleSegmentUploader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microsoft.azure.management.datalake.store.uploader.MultipleSegmentUploader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class MultipleSegmentUploader
extends Object
implements Runnable
    Uploads a local file in parallel by splitting it into several segments, according to the given metadata.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MAX_UPLOAD_ATTEMPT_COUNT
      The maximum attempts to upload a segment of the file before failing out.

      • MAX_UPLOAD_ATTEMPT_COUNT

        public static final int MAX_UPLOAD_ATTEMPT_COUNT
        The maximum attempts to upload a segment of the file before failing out.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultipleSegmentUploader

        public MultipleSegmentUploader(UploadMetadata uploadMetadata,
                               int maxThreadCount,
                               FrontEndAdapter frontEnd)
        Creates a new MultipleSegmentUploader.
        Parameters:
        uploadMetadata - The metadata that keeps track of the file upload.
        maxThreadCount - The maximum number of threads to use. Note that in some cases, this number may not be reached.
        frontEnd - A pointer to the Front End interface to perform the upload to.

    • Method Detail

      • useSegmentBlockBackOffRetryStrategy

        public boolean useSegmentBlockBackOffRetryStrategy()
        Returns:
        A value indicating whether to use a back-off (exponenential) in case of individual block failures. The MultipleSegmentUploader does not use this directly; it passes it on to SingleSegmentUploader.

      • setUseSegmentBlockBackOffRetryStrategy

        public void setUseSegmentBlockBackOffRetryStrategy(boolean isEnabled)
        Parameters:
        isEnabled - A value indicating whether to use a back-off (exponenential) in case of individual block failures. The MultipleSegmentUploader does not use this directly; it passes it on to SingleSegmentUploader.

      • upload

        public void upload()
            throws InterruptedException,
                   AggregateUploadException
        Executes the upload of the segments in the file that were not already uploaded (i.e., those that are in a 'Pending' state).
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if there is some interruption sent during a wait.
        AggregateUploadException - if there are any failures in any of the threads running upload.

      • run

        public void run()
        When an object implementing interface Runnable is used to create a thread, starting the thread causes the object's run method to be called in that separately executing thread.

        The general contract of the method run is that it may take any action whatsoever. In this run, we are allowing each thread to attempt to process all of the remaining segments, which will ultimately result in each thread processing a subset of segments that are still in the queue.

        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
        See Also:
        Thread.run()
